snippet: A group of rebels is seeking to defuse the standoff between fellow insurgents and an affiliate of Al Qaeda that seized the town of Azaz a few weeks ago.
abstract: Group of rebels in northern Syria is struggling to defuse armed standoff pitting insurgents against Al Qaeda affiliate Islamic State of Iraq and Syria for control of strategic town of Azaz near Turkish border; conflict has closed border crossing used to supply rebel movement and raised tensions between rebels seeking ouster of Pres Bashar al-Assad and extremists who want to erase Syria’s borders and establish transnational Islamic state.

byline.contributor: Karam Shoumali and Sebnem Arsu contributed reporting from Istanbul.

lead_paragraph: A group of rebels is seeking to defuse the standoff between fellow insurgents and an affiliate of Al Qaeda that seized the town of Azaz a few weeks ago.

headline.main: Fighting Between Rebels Intensifies Over a Strategic Town in Syria
headline.print_headline: Fighting Between Rebels Intensifies Over a Strategic Town in Syria
